intro: Homalium stipulaceum, commonly known as the velvetleaf or Brazilian cherry, is a tropical evergreen tree belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, dark green leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by bright red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is native to Central and South America. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions worldwide.
